hero.headline: SummarizePDF vs Scholarcy
hero.subheadline: Which academic PDF summarizer is better in 2025?
hero.verdict: SummarizePDF offers modern AI, better pricing, and more flexible features for researchers at all levels.

advantages.title: Modern AI Technology
advantages.description: Scholarcy uses older AI models. SummarizePDF leverages Google's latest Gemini AI for superior understanding, context awareness, and summary quality.

advantages.title: True Batch Processing
advantages.description: Upload your entire research library at once and process all papers simultaneously. Scholarcy's browser extension requires processing one paper at a time.

advantages.title: Better Collaboration
advantages.description: Share projects with teammates, create team workspaces, and collaborate on research. Scholarcy is individual-focused with no team features.

advantages.title: More Export Options
advantages.description: Export to PDF, Word, Markdown, JSON, and Anki flashcards. Scholarcy's export options are more limited and format-locked.

whenToUseCompetitor: Use Scholarcy if you prefer browser-based workflows, need immediate summarization while browsing academic databases, or are heavily invested in their flashcard system.
whenToUseSummarizePDF: Use SummarizePDF for comprehensive research projects, batch processing multiple papers, team collaboration, or when you want the latest AI technology at a better price point.

faq.question: Is SummarizePDF as good as Scholarcy for academic papers?
faq.answer: Yes - SummarizePDF uses newer AI technology (Google Gemini) optimized for academic papers. Many researchers find the summary quality superior, with better context understanding and citation extraction.

faq.question: Does SummarizePDF have a browser extension like Scholarcy?
faq.answer: A browser extension is coming soon. Currently, you upload PDFs directly to the web app, which allows for powerful batch processing that Scholarcy's extension can't match.

faq.question: Can I import my Scholarcy flashcards?
faq.answer: SummarizePDF generates AI flashcards and exports to Anki format. While there's no direct Scholarcy import, you can easily recreate your flashcard collection with better AI-generated cards.

faq.question: Which is better for PhD students?
faq.answer: SummarizePDF is often preferred for comprehensive literature reviews due to batch processing and multi-document analysis. Scholarcy is better for quick, on-the-go summarization while browsing journals.
